channel.title: My ActionTimer is messed up... (It's delay, but whatever)

item.title: My ActionTimer is messed up... (It's delay, but whatever)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

case 1276: // tree if(playerLevel[8] >= 1) { // Thanks to tom:) if(delay < 1) { // Thanks to david:) startAnimation(875); sM("You get 25k."); addSkillXP((25*playerLevel[8]), 8); addItem(995, 25000); delay = 5; } } else { sM("you need 1 wc to cut this!"); }
There you go. Just replace yours with mine.

item.title: My ActionTimer is messed up... (It's delay, but whatever)
item.dc:creator: @PushedPrawn PushedPrawn
item.description:
@PushedPrawn wrote:

case 1276: // tree
if(playerLevel[8] >= 1) { // Thanks to tom:)
startAnimation(875);
sM(“You get 25k.”);
addSkillXP((25*playerLevel[8]), 8);
addItem(995, 25000);
delay = 5;
} else {
sM(“you need 1 wc to cut this!”);
}

I don’t get any errors with compiling, but when i click on a tree it automaticly gives me 25k and i can keep clicking over and over liek 10 times a second and it will just keep giving 25k every time i click… any ideas? i get this error every time i try using a delay timer.

Read full topic
